original_solution_mapping.L1: Greg kept 1 granola bar for each of the 7 days of the week, so there were 20 - 7 = <<20-7=13>>13 bars left.
original_solution_mapping.L2: He traded 3 to his friend Pete, so there were 13 - 3 = 10 bars left.
original_solution_mapping.L3: His 2 sisters split the rest evenly, so each got 10 / 2 = <<10/2=5>>5 granola bars.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2911.
    Returns: the number of granola bars each sister received.
    """
    # L1
    total_bars = 20 # a 20-pack of granola bars
    bars_kept_for_self = 7 # one for each day of the week
    bars_after_keeping = total_bars - bars_kept_for_self

    # L2
    traded_to_pete = 3 # traded three of the remaining bars
    bars_after_trading = bars_after_keeping - traded_to_pete

    # L3
    number_of_sisters = 2 # his two sisters
    bars_per_sister = bars_after_trading / number_of_sisters

    # FA
    answer = bars_per_sister
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Greg kept 1 granola bar for each of the 7 days of the week, so there were {total_bars} - {bars_kept_for_self} = <<{total_bars}-{bars_kept_for_self}={bars_after_keeping}>>{bars_after_keeping} bars left.
He traded {traded_to_pete} to his friend Pete, so there were {bars_after_keeping} - {traded_to_pete} = {bars_after_trading} bars left.

His {number_of_sisters} sisters split the rest evenly, so each got {bars_after_trading} / {number_of_sisters} = <<{bars_after_trading}/{number_of_sisters}={bars_per_sister}>>{bars_per_sister} granola bars.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He traded 7 to his friend Pete, so there were 13 - 7 = 6 bars left.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: His 2 sisters split the rest evenly, so each got 6 / 2 = <<6/2=3>>3 granola bars.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'bars_kept_for_self' (7) was used instead of 'traded_to_pete' (3).
